result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin S Bell Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges for treatment and work; to commence forthwith

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process. 

--the Court authorizes the transfer of the service of this jail term to Dane County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring

The Court orders Mr. Bell to pay any balance due on costs, fees and surcharges within sixty days.  Non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive. (All costs , fees and surcharges have been paid)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[MK] case called at 10:37am. 
Defendant Dustin S Bell in court, in custody, with Attorney Teri Strohschein.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Brief statements about the Department's sentence-recommendation are made by counsel. 

The Court sentences Mr. Bell to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges for treatment and work; to commence forthwith
--the Court authorizes the transfer of the service of this jail term to Dane County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring 
--76 days credit for time already served given
The Court orders Mr. Bell to pay any balance due on costs, fees and surcharges within sixty days.  Non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

[MK] case called at 1:43pm. 
Defendant Dustin S Bell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; elements recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Bell on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required 
--to be subjected to random drug and/or alcohol testing
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take any prescription medications as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit a DNA sample as required by law
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge as calculated by the clerk
--to pay the drug testing fee of $100 
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees 


Counsel indicate that they are unable to calculate days credit for time already served today; they will submit a stipulation on this.
The Court requires Mr. Bell to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 4:00pm today.  
recess 1:47pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

--no possession of paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
Pending the State's Motion, the Court finds the bond to be in revoke status

The Court requires a $1000 CASH Bond, with same non monetary conditions. 

recess 1:53pm.

Case called at 2:24pm [ma]
Attorney Teri Strohschein in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock requests a warrant be issued due to Mr. Bell's non appearance.
The Court issues a warrant, body only.
recess: 2:25pm

[MK] case called at 1:30pm. 
Attorney Teri Strohschein in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that there is a Surety who posted the funds.
Attorney Strohschein indicates that she has not been able to reach Mr. Bell; she has no explanation regarding his non-appearance. 
The Court orders that the Bond is to be forfeited; the clerk is to take action to ensure that the funds are transferred to the County's fund. 
recess 1:32pm, reconvene 1:40pm. 
Attorney Strohschein has exited the courtroom and no longer appears.
The clerk has now alerted the Court that the Surety, Celena Sorenson, was not mailed any notice of today's  hearing, and further, that the Intake Judge "continued" the Bond when Mr. Bell appeared on the Warrant on 8/29/16 in Branch II.  
The Court indicates its viewpoint that Judge Hue saying the bond is continued is not the same as Judge Hue saying that the bond forfeiture is otherwise being called in question; it is not that Judge Hue rescinded this Court's default and forfeiture finding. 
The Court rescinds today's bond forfeiture order based on the lack of notice to the Surety. The Court holds that, given the lack of appearance by Mr. Bell today, his future ability to argue bail forfeiture has been waived by his non-appearance. The Court adjourns the Bail Forfeiture Hearing; the notice of the adjourned hearing date need only be given to Ms. Sorenson. 
recess 1:44pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Adjourned Bail Forfeiture Hearing, including Surety Celena Sorenson in the notices
